intro: Comesperma ericinum f. tasmanicum, commonly known as the Tasmanian heath, is a shrub native to Tasmania, Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
